title: Use da.eye with chunks="auto" fails
body:
Currently if a user tries to create an array with `da.eye(..., chunks="auto")`, it fails. An MRE is included below.
Example: ```python In [1]: import dask.array as da da.ey In [2]: da.eye(100, chunks=10) Out[2]: dask.array In [3]: da.eye(100, chunks="auto") --------------------------------------------------------------------------- ValueError Traceback (most recent call last) in ----> 1 da.eye(100, chunks="auto") ~/Developer/dask/dask/array/creation.py in eye(N, chunks, M, k, dtype) 437 """ 438 if not isinstance(chunks, Integral): --> 439 raise ValueError('chunks must be an int') 440 441 token = tokenize(N, chunk, M, k, dtype) ValueError: chunks must be an int ```

Environment: ```yaml name: daskdev channels: - conda-forge - defaults dependencies: - appnope=0.1.0=py37_1000 - asn1crypto=0.24.0=py37_1003 - attrs=19.1.0=py_0 - backcall=0.1.0=py_0 - blas=1.1=openblas -
